The Death of a Dragon
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Library: Fan Fiction, Poetry, Birthday List, Links & Non-Fiction Archive: Poetry: The Death of a Dragon
By The ShaMan on Wednesday, January 14, 2004 - 12:33 pm:

Scaly beasts of flame and flight,
All their opponents will cower with fright.
When at their ranch, they live in bliss.
Though the looming dread they're sure to miss

Over time,you'll become great friends.
You'll endure many hardships,trials and bends.
But then you will face the hardest of all,
Your eyes will tear and your heart will fall.

This is the day,the day you dread.
You will weep as the dragon droops his head.
He'll remember the times and take one last grin,
And you know you'll never have another friend like him.

By The ShaMan on Wednesday, January 14, 2004 - 12:34 pm:

this is a real tear-jerker i made.hope it touches the heart

By Icelord13 on Wednesday, January 14, 2004 - 01:38 pm:

very nicely done. however, the last two lines need some work. grin and him don't rhyme. Oh well, good poem
